description: Multi-criteria decision-making (MCDM) involves evaluating and prioritizing different options based on multiple conflicting criteria. It is commonly used in various fields where decisions must be made under uncertainty and subjective evaluations.
you_have_this_if: You have multiple options to evaluate.
The criteria for evaluation are not strictly quantitative.
You need to incorporate expert opinions or subjective judgments.
You are facing conflicting criteria that need to be balanced.

approaches.technique: Fuzzy Analytic Hierarchy Process (FAHP) with Triangular q-rung Fuzzy Numbers (TR-q-ROFNS)
approaches.best_for: When you need to evaluate options with subjective criteria and incorporate uncertainty.
approaches.key_tradeoff: This approach balances the complexity of fuzzy logic with the need for structured decision-making.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need to evaluate options with subjective criteria and uncertainty.

start_here: Start with the Fuzzy Analytic Hierarchy Process (FAHP) if you need to incorporate subjective evaluations and handle uncertainty in your decision-making process.
